questions.question: Which of the following is the plural form of young one?
questions.description: There are no apostrophes in plural nouns.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct?
questions.description: We cannot use past time expressions with the present perfect tense.

questions.question: The simple present tense can be used to talk about future.
questions.description: The simple present tense can be used to talk about future events that are part of a time table.

questions.question: The negative form of will is ............................
questions.description: In the case of auxiliary verbs, questions and negatives are made without do.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct?
questions.description: Look is a copular verb we use adjectives to modify copular verbs.

questions.question: Can you lend me ................................ of butter?
questions.description: Pound is a singular countable noun we need an article or another determiner with singular countable nouns.

questions.question: We have got enough money to buy a car. Here enough is an ...............................
questions.description: When enough modifies a noun, it is an adjective.

questions.question: She is old enough to know better. Here enough is an ......................................
questions.description: When enough modifies an adjective, it is an adverb.

questions.question: I love ................................ types of cars.
questions.description: We use these and those with plural nouns.

questions.question: There are no secrets between ....................................
questions.description: We use object pronouns after a preposition.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a form of be?
questions.description: The forms of be are: is, am, are, was and were.

questions.question: My brother loves ...........................................
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with plural nouns when we are talking about things in general.
